trans-unit.source: <properties pageTitle="Managing Media Services Entities with REST API" description="Learn how to manage Media Services entities with REST API." authors="juliako" manager="dwrede" editor="" services="media-services" documentationCenter=""/>
trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="Managing Media Services Entities with REST API" description="Learn how to manage Media Services entities with REST API." authors="juliako" manager="dwrede" editor="" services="media-services" documentationCenter=""/>

trans-unit.source: <tags ms.service="media-services" ms.workload="media" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/11/2015" ms.author="juliako"/>
trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="media-services" ms.workload="media" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/11/2015" ms.author="juliako"/>

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Media Services is a REST-based service built on OData v3.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Media Services is a REST-based service built on OData v3.

trans-unit.source: Because of this, you can add, query, update, and delete entities in much the same way as you can on any other OData service.
trans-unit.target: Because of this, you can add, query, update, and delete entities in much the same way as you can on any other OData service.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions will be called out when applicable.
trans-unit.target: Exceptions will be called out when applicable.

trans-unit.source: For more information on OData, see <linkText>Open Data Protocol documentation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on OData, see <linkText>Open Data Protocol documentation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Adding entities
trans-unit.target: Adding entities

trans-unit.source: Querying entities
trans-unit.target: Querying entities

trans-unit.source: Updating entities
trans-unit.target: Updating entities

trans-unit.source: Deleting entities
trans-unit.target: Deleting entities

trans-unit.source: When working with the Media Services REST API, the following considerations apply:
trans-unit.target: When working with the Media Services REST API, the following considerations apply:

trans-unit.source: When accessing entities in Media Services, you must set specific header fields and values in your HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: When accessing entities in Media Services, you must set specific header fields and values in your HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Setup for Media Services REST API Development</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Setup for Media Services REST API Development</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After successfully connecting to https://media.windows.net, you will receive a 301 redirect specifying another Media Services URI.
trans-unit.target: After successfully connecting to https://media.windows.net, you will receive a 301 redirect specifying another Media Services URI.

trans-unit.source: You must make subsequent calls to the new URI as described in <linkText>Connecting to Media Services using REST API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You must make subsequent calls to the new URI as described in <linkText>Connecting to Media Services using REST API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Every entity in Media Services is added to an entity set, such as Assets, through a POST HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: Every entity in Media Services is added to an entity set, such as Assets, through a POST HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to create an AccessPolicy.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to create an AccessPolicy.

trans-unit.source: Querying and listing entities is straightforward and only involves a GET HTTP request and optional OData operations.
trans-unit.target: Querying and listing entities is straightforward and only involves a GET HTTP request and optional OData operations.

trans-unit.source: The following example retrieves a list of all MediaProcessor entities.
trans-unit.target: The following example retrieves a list of all MediaProcessor entities.

trans-unit.source: You can also retrieve a specific entity or all entity sets associated with a specific entity, such as in the following examples:
trans-unit.target: You can also retrieve a specific entity or all entity sets associated with a specific entity, such as in the following examples:

trans-unit.source: The following example returns only the State property of all Jobs.
trans-unit.target: The following example returns only the State property of all Jobs.

trans-unit.source: The $expand operation is not supported in Media Services as well as the unsupported LINQ methods described in LINQ Considerations (WCF Data Services).
trans-unit.target: The $expand operation is not supported in Media Services as well as the unsupported LINQ methods described in LINQ Considerations (WCF Data Services).

trans-unit.source: Depending on the entity type and the state that it is in, you can update properties on that entity through a PATCH, PUT, or MERGE HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the entity type and the state that it is in, you can update properties on that entity through a PATCH, PUT, or MERGE HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: For more information about these operations, see <linkText>PATCH/PUT/MERGE</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about these operations, see <linkText>PATCH/PUT/MERGE</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to update the Name property on an Asset entity.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows how to update the Name property on an Asset entity.

trans-unit.source: Entities can be deleted in Media Services by using a DELETE HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: Entities can be deleted in Media Services by using a DELETE HTTP request.

trans-unit.source: Depending on the entity, the order in which you delete entities may be important.
trans-unit.target: Depending on the entity, the order in which you delete entities may be important.

trans-unit.source: For example, entities such as Assets require that you revoke (or delete) all Locators that reference that particular Asset before deleting the Asset.
trans-unit.target: For example, entities such as Assets require that you revoke (or delete) all Locators that reference that particular Asset before deleting the Asset.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to delete a Locator that was used to upload a file into blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to delete a Locator that was used to upload a file into blob storage.
